response: "{ \"title\": \"Coprime Sum\", \"description\": \"A set of integers are said to be coprime if the only positive integer that divides all members of the set is 1. Given a list of distinct integers, find the sum of the largest possible set of coprime integers.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef max_coprime_sum(integers: list[int]) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `integers` (list[int]): A list of distinct integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the sum of the largest possible set of coprime integers.\\n\", \"code\": \"from math import gcd\\n\\ndef max_coprime_sum(integers: list[int]) -> int:\\n    # Sort the list in ascending order\\n    integers.sort()\\n    \\n    max_sum = 0\\n    current_set = []\\n    for num in integers:\\n        if not current_set or gcd(*current_set) == 1:\\n            current_set.append(num)\\n            max_sum += num\\n        elif gcd(*current_set, num) == 1:\\n            current_set.append(num)\\n            max_sum += num\\n            while len(current_set) > 1 and gcd(*current_set) != 1:\\n                min_num = min(current_set)\\n                current_set.remove(min_num)\\n                max_sum -= min_num\\n        else:\\n            break\\n    return max_sum\", \"tests\": [\"assert max_coprime_sum([2, 3, 4, 5]) == 9\", \"assert max_coprime_sum([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]) == 10\", \"assert max_coprime_sum([15, 20, 30, 45]) == 75\"] }"
